properties.areaDesc: McLean, IL; Woodford, IL; Tazewell, IL
properties.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 10 at 6:56PM CST by NWS Lincoln IL
properties.description:
This hydrologic outlook includes the following river in Illinois:

Mackinaw River...

The following river information is based on future predicted
rainfall. The exact amount, intensity, timing, and location of the
rain that will occur is still uncertain. These outlook stages are
provided to show what may be expected if the forecast precipitation
occurs. Once there is more certainty about the river forecasts, a
flood warning or statement will be issued if the threat materializes.

For the Mackinaw River near Congerville...the latest stage is 2.1
feet at 7 PM Friday. Flood stage is 13 feet. Moderate flooding is
forecast...with a crest of 14.2 feet early Monday morning...which is
1.2 feet above flood stage. The river should rise above the flood
stage of 13 feet Sunday morning. The river should fall below flood
stage Monday evening. At 13 feet...Widespread agricultural flooding
occurs.
